articles.author: Khanyiso Tshwaku
articles.title: 'Dean's a tough cookie who loves Test cricket,' says SA batting coach as big day looms
articles.description: Dean Elgar now stands between South Africa losing their first Test series at home against India and taking the series all-square to Newlands next week.
articles.content:
• Proteas batting consultant Justin Sammonds said Dean Elgar's wicket holds to the key to how they manage their chase on day four of the second Test against India.

articles.author: Daniella White
articles.title: Cricket to face rain delays as Sydney’s run of beach weather ends
articles.description: Bureau of Meteorology forecaster Olenka Duma said the Ashes Test match to start in Sydney on Wednesday will face rain delays.
articles.content: She said the muggy and humid conditions are being driven by ex-tropical cyclone Seth sitting over the Coral Sea. Meanwhile, a trough over the inland areas will move towards the coast and bring storms… [+718 chars]

articles.title: PCB hands Umar Akmal three-year ban from all cricket | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.description: Penalty after the batsman pleaded guilty to not reporting corrupt approaches | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.content: Umar Akmal's troubled cricket career has hit its biggest roadblock yet, with the PCB handing him a ban from all representative cricket for three years after he pleaded guilty of failing to report det… [+1506 chars]

articles.title: What we learned from watching the 1992 World Cup final in full again | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.description: Wides, lbw calls, swing - plenty of things were different in white-ball cricket back then | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.content: Last week, we at ESPNcricinfo did something we have been thinking of doing for eight years now: pretend-live ball-by-ball commentary for a classic cricket match. We knew the result, yes, but we tried… [+6823 chars]
